summary: Source map parsing during worker initialization consumes excessive RAM (2GB+), particularly when running multiple workers on a single machine. The issue is caused by the extractSourceMap function loading entire source maps into memory without optimization.
userImpact: Workers consume excessive memory during boot (2GB+) when running multiple workers on a single machine, making large-scale deployments impractical.
rootCause: The extractSourceMap function and SourceMapConsumer load entire source maps into memory without lazy-loading or memory-efficient parsing strategies.
proposedFix: Add an option to disable source map extraction during bundling via webpackConfigHook, with proper error handling in downstream consumers like addWorkflowBundle.
workaround: Load workers synchronously with global.gc() calls between them to manage memory pressure, or pre-build bundles in CI/CD without source maps.
keyQuote: They sometimes take up over 2GB of RAM simply from parsing the source maps. I am curious if there is a way to optionally allow turning off source maps?
